Package com.jme.bullet.objects.infos

Class RigidBodyMotionState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme.bullet.objects.infos.RigidBodyMotionState
  • public class RigidBodyMotionState
extends java.lang.Object
    The motion state (transform) of a rigid body, with thread-safe access.
    Author:
    normenhansen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RigidBodyMotionState()
      Instantiate a motion state.

    • Method Detail

      • applyTransform

        public boolean applyTransform​(com.jme.scene.Spatial spatial)
        If the motion state has been updated, apply the new transform to the specified spatial.
        Parameters:
        spatial - where to apply the physics transform (not null, modified)
        Returns:
        true if changed

      • getWorldLocation

        public com.jme.math.Vector3f getWorldLocation()
        Copy the location from this motion state.
        Returns:
        the pre-existing location vector (in physics-space coordinates, not null)

      • getWorldRotation

        public com.jme.math.Matrix3f getWorldRotation()
        Read the rotation of this motion state (as a matrix).
        Returns:
        the pre-existing rotation matrix (in physics-space coordinates, not null)

      • getWorldRotationQuat

        public com.jme.math.Quaternion getWorldRotationQuat()
        Read the rotation of this motion state (as a quaternion).
        Returns:
        the pre-existing instance (in physics-space coordinates, not null)

      • setVehicle

        public void setVehicle​(PhysicsVehicle vehicle)
        Parameters:
        vehicle - which vehicle will use this motion state

      • isApplyPhysicsLocal

        public boolean isApplyPhysicsLocal()
        Test whether physics-space coordinates should match the spatial's local coordinates.
        Returns:
        true if matching local coordinates, false if matching world coordinates

      • setApplyPhysicsLocal

        public void setApplyPhysicsLocal​(boolean applyPhysicsLocal)
        Alter whether physics-space coordinates should match the spatial's local coordinates.
        Parameters:
        applyPhysicsLocal - true→match local coordinates, false→match world coordinates (default=false)

      • getObjectId

        public long getObjectId()
        Read the unique id of the native object.
        Returns:
        id (not zero)

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Finalize this motion state just before it is destroyed. Should be invoked only by a subclass or by the garbage collector.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - ignored by the garbage collector
